h5database.extractor.implementation module¶

class h5database.extractor.implementation.ExtSuperResolution[source]¶

Bases: h5database.skeletal.abstract_extractor.ExtractCallable

Implementation of ExtractCallable for Super Resolution data, where the input is the blurred image, and the label is the ground truth (original image).

static extract(inputs: Tuple[object, ...], type_order: Sequence[str], obj: h5database.database.database.DataExtractor, file: str, data_shape: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]], **kwargs) → Tuple[Tuple, numpy.ndarray, Sequence[str], Any][source]¶

Simple patchification of the low resolution image/ground truth obtained from the “get_inputs”. :param inputs (): Input tuple. :param type_order (): Defined type order for the output. :param obj (): Associated DataExtractor. :param file (): :param data_shape (): :param **kwargs ():

Keyword Arguments

  • stride_size (int) – Stride size of patch extraction. Determine the overlapping ratio.

  • flatten (bool) – Whether returns a flattened patch array or retain the original shape, given the patch location. Default is True.

Returns

Tuple of output arrays grouped by types in a tuple. is_valid (np.ndarray): type_order (Sequence[str]): An ordered sequence of type names. extra_info (Any): Placeholder for anything else to report.

Return type

patches (Tuple)

static get_inputs(obj: h5database.database.database.DataExtractor, file: str, patch_types: Sequence[str], data_shape: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]], **kwargs) → Tuple[object, ...][source]¶

Prepare the inputs: low resolution image and the ground truth. :param obj (): Associated DataExtractor obj. :param file (): Path of the source file. :param patch_types (): Data type names of all target inputs. :param data_shape (): Shapes of data.

Keyword Arguments

  • resize (float) – Resize factor in interval of (0, 1) for both width and height.

  • interp (int) – Interpolation Flags for cv2.resize.

Returns:

static type_order() → Sequence[str][source]¶
Returns

Annotation of designed data type order.

class h5database.extractor.implementation.ExtTissueByMask[source]¶

Bases: h5database.skeletal.abstract_extractor.ExtractCallable

Extraction of Tissue patches from PNG ROI, screened by a corresponding tissue binary mask. todo: Refactor and generalize it for data without mask

static extract(inputs: Tuple[numpy.ndarray, Sequence, numpy.ndarray], type_order: Sequence[str], obj: h5database.database.database.DataExtractor, file: str, data_shape: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]], **kwargs) → Tuple[Tuple[object, ...], Sequence[bool], Sequence[str], Any][source]¶
Parameters

  • () (**kwargs) – Input tuple.

  • () – Defined type order for the output.

  • () – Associated DataExtractor.

  • () –

  • () –

  • () –

Keyword Arguments

  • stride_size (int) – Stride size of patch extraction. Determine the overlapping ratio.

  • flatten (bool) – Whether returns a flattened patch array or retain the original shape, given the patch location. Default is True.

  • dispose (bool) – Flat that whether dispose the “invalid” patches, with valid tag of 0, if tissue% is too low. Explicitly discard the result from the array only if flatten is True.

  • tissue_area_thresh (bool) – Percentage of minimum required tissue area.

Returns

arrays of patchified images/masks/labels. valid_tag (np.ndarray): Array of valid tag by each single patch. type_order (Sequence[str]): A sequence of ordered type names. extra_info (Any): Placeholder for any other extra information to export.

Return type

(patches_im, patches_mask, labels)

static get_inputs(obj: h5database.database.database.DataExtractor, file: str, patch_types: Sequence[str], data_shape: Dict[str, Tuple[int, ...]], **kwargs) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, object][source]¶

Prepare the reading of image, mask files and the class id. :param obj (): Associated DataExtractor obj. :param file (): Path of the source file. :param patch_types (): Data type names of all target inputs. :param data_shape (): Shapes of data.

Keyword Arguments

  • resize (float) – Resize factor in interval of (0, 1) for both width and height.

  • interp (int) – Interpolation Flags for cv2.resize.

  • mask_suffix (str) – file suffix of masks for the mapping from source_img_name –> mask_name. Default: “_mask”

  • mask_ext (str) – File extension of mask files. Default: “png”.

  • mask_dir (str) – File Directory of all masks.

Returns:

static get_mask_name(img_full_path: str, mask_dir: str, suffix: str = '_mask', extension: str = 'png')[source]¶

Legacy codes. Map the source image file name to the mask file name. :param img_full_path (): :param mask_dir (): :param suffix (): :param extension ():
